1:
[Mingxi County Meteorological Observatory issues blue frost warning] On January 1, 2025, Mingxi County Meteorological Observatory issued a blue frost warning signal at 8 am. According to the latest meteorological data analysis, affected by the strong cold air, it is expected that in the next 48 hours, the minimum ground temperature in most areas of our county will drop below 0℃, and low temperatures of -2℃ to -4℃ may occur in some mountainous areas, which may have a certain impact on agriculture, forestry and water supply facilities.

The meteorological department reminds that all townships and relevant departments need to take anti-cold and anti-freeze measures in advance, especially strengthen the protection of crops and livestock, and ensure the safe operation of infrastructure such as water supply pipelines. At the same time, it is recommended that residents pay attention to keeping warm, reduce outdoor activities, and prevent the occurrence of colds and other diseases. Please pay close attention to weather changes and take preventive measures in time to ensure the safety of life and property.

Mingxi County Meteorological Observatory will continue to track this cold air process and issue the latest forecast and warning information in a timely manner. All sectors of society are requested to remain vigilant and jointly respond to the challenges brought by this frost weather.
2:
[Weining County Meteorological Observatory issues blue frost warning]

On January 1, 2025, Weining County Meteorological Observatory issued a blue frost warning signal at 8 am. According to the latest meteorological data analysis, affected by strong cold air, it is expected that in the next 48 hours, the minimum ground temperature in most areas of Weining County will drop below 0℃, and frosty weather may occur, which will have a certain impact on agriculture, transportation and residents' lives.

The meteorological department reminds that all relevant departments and the public need to take cold prevention and warming measures in advance, especially the agricultural department should strengthen the protection of crops, and take measures such as covering and irrigation to reduce the harm of frost; the transportation department needs to pay attention to the icing of the road to ensure traffic safety; residents should pay attention to adding clothes to keep warm and prevent the occurrence of colds and other diseases.

Weining County Meteorological Observatory will continue to pay attention to weather changes and update warning information in a timely manner. Please keep paying attention, make precautions, and ensure that you can safely pass this frosty weather process.

[Weining County Meteorological Observatory]
3:
[Fangzheng County Meteorological Observatory issues yellow warning signal for road ice and snow]

On January 1, 2025, Fangzheng County Meteorological Observatory issued a yellow warning signal for road ice and snow at 9 am. According to the latest meteorological data analysis, affected by strong cold air, Fangzheng County is expected to experience significant snowfall in the next 24 hours, with moderate to heavy snowfall in some areas. As the temperature drops, snow and ice will accumulate on the road, causing a great impact on traffic.

Fangzheng County Meteorological Observatory reminds residents and drivers to pay attention to traffic safety when traveling and try to reduce unnecessary outings. When driving a vehicle, you should slow down, keep a safe distance, avoid emergency braking and sharp turns, and ensure driving safety. At the same time, relevant departments need to make preparations for snow removal and anti-skid work in advance to ensure smooth roads and the safety of people's lives and property.

Please pay close attention to subsequent weather forecasts and warning information, take precautions, and jointly respond to the challenges brought by this ice and snow weather.

[Fangzheng County Meteorological Observatory]

On January 1, 2025, the Wuxi County Meteorological Observatory in Chongqing City issued a blue frost warning signal at 8 am. According to the latest meteorological data analysis, affected by the strong cold air, it is expected that from January 1 to 2, the minimum ground temperature in most areas of Wuxi County will drop below 0℃, and frost weather that will affect agriculture may occur. This frost process mainly affects mountainous areas and plains, especially crops and economic fruit trees may suffer varying degrees of frost damage.

The meteorological department reminds that all townships and relevant departments need to make preparations for cold and frost prevention in advance, strengthen protective measures for crops susceptible to frost damage, and reduce the impact of low temperature on agricultural production. At the same time, it is recommended that residents keep warm and take anti-slip measures when traveling to ensure safety. Please pay close attention to the latest forecast and warning information released by the meteorological department and arrange production and life reasonably.

Wuxi County Meteorological Observatory will continue to closely monitor weather changes, update warning information in a timely manner, and provide accurate meteorological services to the public.

[Wuxi County Meteorological Observatory]

8:
[Shangluo City Shangzhou District Meteorological Observatory issues blue warning for strong winds]

On January 1, 2025, Shangluo City Shangzhou District Meteorological Observatory issued a blue warning for strong winds at 9 am. According to the latest meteorological data analysis, it is expected that in the next 24 hours, Shangzhou District will experience strong winds with an average wind force of level 6 and gusts of level 7 to 8. This strong wind is mainly affected by strong cold air, which may have a certain impact on transportation, agriculture and outdoor activities.

Shangzhou District Meteorological Observatory reminds the general public and relevant departments to make preparations for wind protection: strengthen doors, windows, fences, scaffolding and other structures that are easily blown by the wind; properly Place outdoor items that are easily affected by strong winds properly; reduce unnecessary outdoor activities, especially high-altitude operations and water activities should be suspended; drivers should pay attention to driving safety and avoid driving in strong winds. 

The meteorological department will continue to pay attention to weather changes and update warning information in a timely manner. Citizens are requested to obtain the latest weather information through official channels to ensure their own safety. 

[Shangluo City Shangzhou District Meteorological Observatory]
January 1, 2025

This warning aims to raise public awareness of the upcoming strong winds, take necessary measures to reduce losses, and protect people's lives and property.

The Tieli Meteorological Observatory reminds the general public and relevant departments to take preventive measures: drivers should slow down, keep a safe distance, and pay attention to driving safety; pedestrians should wear masks when going out and try to reduce outdoor activity time; relevant departments need to strengthen traffic management to ensure smooth roads and traffic safety. At the same time, it is recommended that schools, kindergartens and other educational institutions appropriately adjust outdoor activity arrangements to ensure the health and safety of students.

Please pay close attention to the latest forecast and warning information released by the meteorological department, arrange travel plans reasonably, and ensure the safety of personal and property.

The Tieli Meteorological Observatory will continue to pay attention to weather changes and update warning information in a timely manner.

19:
**Mianzhu City, Deyang City issues yellow warning for road icing**

On January 2, 2024, the Meteorological Observatory of Mianzhu City, Deyang City, Sichuan Province issued a yellow warning for road icing. According to the monitoring of the meteorological department, due to the influence of low temperature, rain and snow, it is expected that in the next 12 hours, some high-altitude areas and mountainous roads in Mianzhu City will experience road icing that will affect traffic.

Meteorological experts remind that the road icing is mainly concentrated in the night to early morning, the temperature is low, the road surface is slippery, and the visibility is poor. Drivers need to pay special attention to driving safety. Slow down, keep a safe distance between vehicles, and avoid emergency braking. At the same time, it is recommended that relevant departments strengthen road inspections and take anti-skid measures in a timely manner to ensure safe and smooth traffic. 

Citizens should learn about road conditions in advance when traveling, try to avoid icy roads, and choose public transportation or walking, which are safer ways of travel. Families with elderly and children should reduce going out, pay attention to cold and keep warm, and ensure personal safety. 

Mianzhu Meteorological Observatory will continue to pay attention to weather changes, update warning information in a timely manner, and provide the public with the latest meteorological services. 

(End)
